thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Thursday, 01 Mar 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Daimler buys Europcar out of car-sharing venture

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Daimler buys Europcar out of car-sharing venture
text:
FRANKFURT, March 1 (Reuters) - German carmaker Daimler has agreed to buy Europcarâ€™s 25 percent stake in car-sharing service Car2Go for 70 million euros ($85 million), the two companies said on Thursday, paving the way for a car-sharing alliance with BMW.
A person familiar with the matter told Reuters in January that Daimler and BMW were close to agreeing to combine their car-sharing services Car2Go and DriveNow.
BMW in January bought out its partner Sixt from DriveNow. ($1 = 0.8205 euros) (Reporting by Maria Sheahan; Editing by Edwina Gibbs)
